Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. -PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizes an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption be authorized in the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption shall extend and apply to property in St. Tammany Parish only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of St. Tammany Parish voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Mandeville Prop.#1 -- 5.08 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Mandeville Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Police Department Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 5.08 mills property tax renewal for providing additional funds for operating and maintaining the police department, including the payment of salaries and benefits of police personnel.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Mandeville, State of Louisiana (the "City"), continue to levy a special tax of five and eight hundredths (5.08) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $873,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of providing additional funds for operating and maintaining the police department of said City, including the payment of salaries and benefits of police personnel?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Mandeville Prop.#2 -- 3.38 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Mandeville Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Police Department Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 3.38 mills property tax renewal for providing additional funds for operating and maintaining the police department, including the payment of salaries and benefits of police personnel.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Mandeville, State of Louisiana (the "City"), continue to levy a special tax of three and thirty-eight hundredths (3.38) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $581,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of providing additional funds for operating and maintaining the police department of said City, including the payment of salaries and benefits of police personnel?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Pearl River Prop. #1 -- 1% S&U - Mayor & BOA - 25 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Pearl River Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(1% Sales Tax Renewal)

Summary:  25-year renewal of a one percent (1%) sales tax for the Town of Pearl River, to fund the maintenance and operation of the Police Department, including the acquisition of Police Department vehicles and equipment.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Town of Pearl River, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, the Uniform Local Sales Tax Code (La. R.S. 47:337.1, et seq.) and other constitutional and statutory authority, continue to levy and collect a one percent (1%) tax upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental and consumption and storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property, and on sales of services in the Town, for an additional period of twenty-five (25) years, commencing January 1, 2012, and ending December 31, 2036, such tax having been originally approved at an election held in the Town on April 4, 1987, with the proceeds of such tax to be used for the purpose of funding the maintenance and operation of the Pearl River Police Department, including the acquisition of Police Department vehicles and equipment? (Estimated annual revenues:
$600,000)

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Pearl River Prop. #2 -- 4.17 Mills - Mayor & BOA - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Pearl River Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  Renewal of a 10-year 4.17-mill tax for the Town of Pearl River, to be used for street improvements.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Pearl River, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, continue to levy and collect a special tax of four and seventeen hundredths (4.17) mills on all the property subject to taxation within the Town, for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, inclusive, with the proceeds of such tax to be used for the purpose of improving streets? (Estimated annual revenues: $66,000)

Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. 2 Proposition
(Millage)

Summary:  10 year, 3 mills property tax for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other recreational facilities in Recreation District No. 2.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of three (3) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $48,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other recreational facilities in said District, together with the necessary furnishings and equipment therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. #3 -- 25 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 3 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 25 mills property tax renewal for the purpose of maintaining, acquiring, constructing, improving and operating the District's fire protection and rescue services facilities and paying for related fire services.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a twenty-five (25) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $1,115,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of maintaining, acquiring, constructing, improving and operating the District's fire protection and rescue services facilities and paying for related fire services, said tax being a renewal of three separate taxes approved by the voters for the same purpose at an election held on January 18, 2003, said taxes to expire in the year 2012?
